content: janara bralette designed by rowena revamonte email handcraftedbyroo@gmail com ig handcrafted_by_ro janara bralette is a simple and stylish top the name is derived from janus god of snow in roman mythology the granny square detailing looks like a snowflake at first glance this is a size inclusive top and gorgeous in any color you choose the pattern comes with written instructions pictures and vid links to guide you through the process of creating this piece happy crocheting 1 | pag e materials stitch abbreviation double_crochet double_crochet  sport 2 or dk 3 single_crochet- single_crochet  3 5 mm crochet hook slip_stitch slip_stitch  measuring tape chain-space chain space  scissors chain chain  darning needle beg beginning  stitch marker fc foundation chain special stitches front post treble_crochet fptr yo 2 times insert your hook from front to back to front around the post of the designated stitch yo pull up a loop yo pull thru 2 loops on your hook 3 times front post double_crochet fpdc yo insert your hook from front to back to front around the post of the next stitch yo pull up a loop yo pull thru 2 loops on your hook yo pull thru remaining two loops on your hook pattern notes  ch3 at the beg of the row counts as a stitch  words written in blue are links to a video tutorial 2 | pag e bra cups in all sizes bra cups make 2 measure from your nipple to your under boob work on fc that corresponds to the measurement you have to start work on your fc single_crochet into the 2nd chain from the hook until the 2nd to the last chain work single_crochet ch1 single_crochet in the last chain single_crochet on the other side of the chain ch1 turn *single_crochet in the next sts single_crochet ch1 single_crochet in the ch1-space* repeat * * until you have a bra cup that covers your boob i left a long tail about twice the width of the cup for sewing before i cut the yarn for reference only my granny square measures granny square 3 5 in row 1 make a magic_ring or chain 5 sl st into the 1st chain to form a ring chain 3 11 double_crochet through the ring 12 slip_stitch on top of ch3 chain 3 row 2 increase turn double_crochet in the same st 2 double_crochet in the next sts 24 slip_stitch on top of ch3 cut your yarn 3 | pag e note fptr sts are all done in row1 fpdc and double_crochet sts are all done in row 2 row 3 attach your second color in the any st chain 3 double_crochet in the same st fptr in a st 2dc in the next st * fpdc in the next st 2dc skip a st fptr 2dc * repeat * * around the circle slip_stitch on top of ch3 cut your yarn total stitch count 6 fptr 6 fpdc 12 double_crochet row 4 attach
